name: Hotel Kilkenny

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We go to Kilkenny every November for a weekend. The first room we got was beside the toilets and the hand dryers were so loud we could hardly hear the Tv, we as to move and the lady on reception was very helpful and got us a new room. The staff are very help full and the food is great the only complaint is some other guests can been very loud coming in at night and banging door's so not much sleep on the Saturday. But all in all a great hotel with great Irish staff with lot's of local knowledge.
reviews.title: weekend away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have (couple) returned from a 'last minute' three night B&B stay at this hotel. This is a lovely Hotel and as many other reviewers have stated the staff are the best asset! ever so helpful courteous obliging nothing is too much trouble thank you all for such an enjoyable stay. Great value.
reviews.title: Just a lovely place to rest your head

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is excellent and very reasonable, three courses served in the bar + 1 tea & 1 pt. O’beer €54 – just lovely - available until 8.30pm. The room was well appointed and nicely decorated we had an upgrade to a deluxe room, which was very spacious immaculately clean with good sized bathroom. The room temperature was just perfect. Rooms are cleaned every day, towels available as requested. We like an under sheet for the duvet, and it was made available in an instant. Gowns and slippers were provided.
reviews.title: Staff doing their very best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast is twofold, there is buffet table, cereal, fruit, pastries, juice, etc; hot food is served to your table from a varied menu by very helpful staffs, everything such as a full Irish to vegetarian to scrambled eggs etc. to whatever mix you like.
reviews.title: Great weekend in a hotel where staff were so helpfull.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sleep quality is excellent our bed was very comfortable, yes it was two singles pulled together, so it was nice and large and not a problem whatsoever – slept like a log.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel was absolutely a gem in the crown of Ireland. The hospitality was superb, the staff so accommodating and friendly. The ambiance was second to none. The food was delicious and the service dynamic. If you're ever looking for a friendly quaint place to stay, well here it is!!! Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Firstly, I'd point out that if 3.5 out of 5 were possible, I'd give the Hotel Kilkenny that score. Overall, it's a solid hotel and the staff are very friendly and helpful, but there are a few issues that should be pointed out.
reviews.title: A mixed experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food and the staff in the bar are very good, and the prices there are quite reasonable, but breakfast was quite disappointing. The range of choice was typical for an Irish hotel, but the quality of the breakfast ingredients was quite poor I felt. Breakfast was included in my room rate (more on that below), but I certainly wouldn't pay 13 euro for the breakfast itself.
reviews.title: Very good food and excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: The room itself was okay in terms of the space and equipment, but the rooms are a bit drab. Certainly the wing of the hotel where the bedrooms are located doesn't seem to be finished or furbished to the same level as the common areas such as the bar and the lobby.
reviews.title: Just ok..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: None of these issues would be a deal-breaker, nor do they make this a bad hotel, except for the fact that I think it's very overpriced for what it is. It seems hotel accommodation in Kilkenny is quite expensive overall, but my room was 150 euro, including breakfast, and I think anything over 100 euro (120 max) is excessive considering the standard of the hotel and the breakfast. As I have said: this isn't a bad hotel, but it's expensive for what it is.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just returned from a 2 night stay in this hotel with my partner and have been left underwhelmed to be honest. The main hotel areas are quite nice, bar, lobby etc however the room is way off 4 star standard. The bath was grubby with hair in it, the bathroom floor was not swept and the main room carpet was not clean. The bed was comfy although seems to be just a standard double so a bit on the small side ( the other half is 6'1 so likes to keep his feet in the bed!!) The gym and pool are a fantastic addition to the hotel, both are really high standard and I really enjoyed my time there. I have to say that although the hotel was not the best the staff were really friendly and informative. We stayed on the ground floor which I found to be noisy. Breakfast was good both mornings and bar food was fine for light lunch. We did not eat in the restaurant so I cannot comment on the food there. Overall we had a nice stay but I would not be bothered to return.
reviews.title: Not a 4 star hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a de-luxe room expecting to get a lovely room with the few extras. Oh what a let down. The room was just so smelly! We thought at first it was the drains but the smell was more in the bedroom. We spent one night in the room - big mistake. We were changed to another room for 2nd night which was just marginally better. Definite smelly drains here and water took ages draining out of bath!!! Also the extremely noisy fan in bathrooms go on continuously - cannot be turned off. A bad exprience never to be repeated and will be advising all my friends to beware.
reviews.title: Definitely not a 4star hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel was fine overall. It was in a good location close to all major roads. There was ample parking. The staff were helpful and very friendly. the main hotel bar, lobby and restaurant were lovely well decorated and clean. The room however was not what i expected and it is probably a person cripe but there was a shower curtain and i hate them! the room was clean and had everthing I need i just expected more when comparing to other hotels.
reviews.title: This hotel was fine not what I had expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Kilkenny for two nights, while attending The Ploughing Championships. It was an ideal location. Very happy with staff, especially Susan at reception. Look foward to staying there again.
reviews.title: "lovely experience"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night recently and it's a perfectly fine hotel. The place is clean and comfortable but a bit of a walk to town. 15 minutes which isn't terrible, but be prepared as there is NOTHING along the route.
reviews.title: Decent place, bit of a walk to town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We recently stayed in hotel Kilkenny for 2 nights, Friday and Saturday night as we were attending our friends wedding in a different hotel. I hate giving this hotel only 3 stars but unfortunately thats all it scored for me.
reviews.title: Ok if you get a good deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is good, easy access from all main routes and only 10 minutes walk to the city center.
reviews.title: one night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Reception and all ground floor areas look renovated and fresh, so you do get a very good impression when you walk into the hotel. Unfortunately the rooms are not as good. We stayed in the standard room on the 4th floor and our room was small, with a very dated bathroom. It looked like they did update the actual room, but didnt do anything with the bathroom. For me a good shower is one of the essentials in any hotel but in our room we had this old type non movable shower, which was placed way too high and with a low water pressure I literally got dribbles of water on me.
reviews.title: Hotel Kilkenny

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was ok, but blanket was very thick and pillows were too soft (but that can be all down to personal preferences).
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast in the morning was ok, I expected a better selection for a 4* hotel, but there was something there for everyone.
reviews.title: Great food. We have never stayed here. Just eaten in the restaurant

description: Four Star Hotel Kilkenny is less than 10 min walk from the City Centre. Free ultrafast wireless broadband in public spaces. Facilities include: 20m swimmingpool, superb gym, beauty lodge, onsite hair salon, in door golf swin analysis room and superb kids club. Live music five nights a week in Pure bar. State of the art conference and wedding facilities. Free carparking.
